ai.summary: Kenton Starcross Circular is an 11 km moderate hike in the UK that forms a loop starting near Kenton and Starcross. The route offers varied countryside scenery, including fields, hedgerows, and modest elevation changes, with opportunities for wildlife and quiet viewpoints.
ai.terrain_summary: The terrain combines grassy field crossings, farm tracks, woodland paths, and occasional stiles. Expect uneven surfaces, some mud after rain, and gentle ascents with a few short ups and downs.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for typical UK weather and shorter daylight hours in winter. Check the forecast, bring suitable clothing and footwear, and carry a map or GPS. Keep to established paths, close gates, and be mindful of livestock. Tell someone your route and expected return time. Stay hydrated, carry snacks, and have a basic first aid kit. If near water, take care around edges and tides if applicable.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing and a waterproof outer layer
Map and compass or GPS device
Headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries
Warm hat and gloves for cold weather
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) for milder weather and longer daylight; the route can also be tackled in winter with proper clothing and gear.

seo.title: Kenton Starcross Circular – 11 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the Kenton Starcross Circular, an 11 km moderate hike in the UK featuring varied terrain, gentle climbs, and scenic countryside. Includes safety tips and gear recommendations.
